DOC.brief_summary: Background Objectives : Spinal puncture painful procedure may cause patient refusal spinal anesthesia future surgery . It could minimize topical infiltration local anesthetic intravenous opioid application procedure . Objective efficacy intravenous fentanyl alleviate pain spinal needle insertion . Methods : Prospective , randomize study include 88 adult ( 33-55 age , ASA I/II ) , schedule low leg surgery . Patients divide four equal study group : spinal needle ( Quincke , 26G ) introducer ( 20G ) insert alone , three minute local anesthetic infiltration ( 2 ml 2 % lidocaine , 25Gx11/4 '' needle ) intravenous fentanyl application ( 0.001 mg kg-1 ) without local anesthetic , fentanyl introducer . Pain assess immediately procedure VAS score . MAP , HR SaO2 record . Sedation assess Ramsay score . Statistical analysis perform SPSS 11.0 .
